bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this regulation:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Motor Fuel Tax Act;
annual period means the period established by the director under section 1.21;
base jurisdiction, in relation to a carrier, means the jurisdiction

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in which the carrier's IFTA commercial vehicles are registered,
from which control of the operations of those vehicles is exercised,
where the operational records of those vehicles are maintained or can be made available, and
within which at least some of those vehicles travel;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: dye means a type of dye authorized by the director in accordance with section 5.8;
flight means a trip between the takeoff and landing of an aircraft, whether or not the trip is a portion of a longer route;
IFTA means the International Fuel Tax Agreement;
IFTA decal means a carrier decal issued to a carrier who is registered and licensed in accordance with IFTA;
IFTA jurisdiction means a jurisdiction that is a member of IFTA;
IFTA licence means a carrier licence issued to a carrier who is registered and licensed in accordance with IFTA;
IFTA licensee means a holder of an IFTA licence;
international air service means a person who

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: owns or operates a commercial air service that provides

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: international air transportation of passengers, goods or both, or
international air services other than the transportation of passengers, goods or both

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to members of the public for a fee, and
does not have flights that connect a location in British Columbia with any other location in Canada in any commercial air service;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: recreational vehicle means a vehicle that is used solely for personal pleasure by an individual and includes, without limitation, any of the following vehicles when so used:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: motor homes;
pickup trucks with attached campers;
buses;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: spouse means a person who

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is married to another person, or
is living with another person in a marriage-like relationship, and has done so for a continuous period of at least 2 years.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of the Act and this regulation:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: alternative motor fuel means a Category 1 alternative motor fuel, a Category 2 alternative motor fuel or a Category 3 alternative motor fuel, within the meaning of Part 3.1, but does not include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: renewable diesel fuel,
ethanol, or
fuel that contains renewable diesel fuel or ethanol;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: IFTA commercial vehicle means a motor vehicle that is used interprovincially or internationally for the commercial carriage of passengers or goods and that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has 2 axles and either a gross vehicle weight or registered gross vehicle weight exceeding 11 800 kg,
has 3 or more axles regardless of weight, or
when combined with the trailer with which it is used, has a gross vehicle weight exceeding 11 800 kg,

bcl:definition.bcl:text: but does not include a recreational vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 97/2008.]

In this section, interjurisdictional rail service means a person who owns or operates a commercial rail service that offers interprovincial or international rail transportation of passengers, goods or both to members of the public for a fee.
Subject to subsection (3), the director may issue a registered consumer certificate under section 37 of the Act to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an interjurisdictional rail service;
an international air service.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Coloured fuel for use in operating a locomotive is a prescribed subcategory of a type of fuel for the purposes of section 37 of the Act.

The director may issue a registered consumer certificate to an international air service only if the international air service holds a licence issued by the Canadian Transportation Agency and, if required by Transport Canada, an operating certificate issued by Transport Canada for each type of aircraft owned or operated by the international air service.

If a collector holds an appointment under section 28 (1) or 32 (2) of the Act, as those provisions read immediately before July 1, 2008, the director must cancel the collector's appointment as provided in section 30 (5) of the Act.

If a registered consumer holds a registered consumer certificate under section 37 (1) of the Act, as that provision read immediately before July 1, 2008, the director must cancel the registered consumer's appointment as provided in section 37.1 (6) of the Act.
The director must establish an annual period for the purposes of this Part and Part 3.2.
If the director changes the dates of the annual period,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the director may establish an interim period for the purposes of transition, and
if the director establishes an interim period under paragraph (a), the interim period constitutes an annual period for the purposes of this Part and Part 3.2.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), a collector who is required to remit tax or pay security under section 35 (1) or 38 (1) of the Act must, on or before the 15th day of each month in respect of tax collected or security payable on sales in the previous month,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director a return in a form specified by the director, and
remit or pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax collected or security payable for that previous month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may permit a collector referred to in subsection (1) to deliver returns and pay tax on a quarterly or annual basis.

A collector permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and remit tax or pay security on a quarterly basis must, in respect of tax collected or security payable on sales in each calendar quarter,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the first month following the calendar quarter, a return in a form specified by the director, and
remit or pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax collected or security payable for that calendar quarter.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A collector permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and remit tax or pay security on an annual basis must, in respect of tax collected or security payable on sales in each annual period,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the month following the month in which the annual period ends, a return in a form specified by the director, and
remit or pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax collected or security payable for that annual period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a collector has not collected tax or is not required to pay security on sales in a previous month, a calendar quarter or an annual period, as applicable, the collector must nonetheless deliver a return, in accordance with subsection (1) (a), (3) (a) or (4) (a), in respect of the previous month, calendar quarter or annual period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Payments and returns — deputy collectors and retail dealers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), a deputy collector or retail dealer who is required to remit tax under section 34 (7) of the Act must, on or before the 15th day of each month in respect of tax collected in the previous month,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director a return in a form specified by the director, and
remit with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that previous month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may permit a deputy collector or retail dealer referred to in subsection (1) to deliver returns and remit tax on a quarterly or annual basis.
A deputy collector or retail dealer permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and remit tax on a quarterly basis must, in respect of tax collected in each calendar quarter,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the first month following the calendar quarter, a return in a form specified by the director, and
remit with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax collected for that calendar quarter.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A deputy collector or retail dealer permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and remit tax on an annual basis must, in respect of tax collected in each annual period,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the month following the month in which the annual period ends, a return in a form specified by the director, and
remit with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax collected for that annual period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless the director specifies otherwise, a deputy collector or retail dealer who has delivered a return under this section in respect of a previous month, a calendar quarter or an annual period, as applicable, must continue to deliver a return, in accordance with subsection (1) (a), (3) (a) or (4) (a), in respect of each subsequent month, calendar quarter or annual period, whether or not tax is collected in respect of the subsequent month, calendar quarter or annual period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Payments and returns — amounts collected as if tax

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), a person who is required under section 35.1 (1) of the Act to remit an amount collected as if it were tax imposed under the Act must, on or before the 15th day of each month in respect of the amount collected in the previous month,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director a return in a form specified by the director, and
remit with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount collected in that previous month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may permit a person referred to in subsection (1) to deliver returns and remit amounts on a quarterly or annual basis.

A person permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and remit amounts on a quarterly basis must, in respect of the amount collected in each calendar quarter as if it were tax imposed under the Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the first month following the calendar quarter, a return in a form specified by the director, and
remit with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount collected in that calendar quarter.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and remit amounts on an annual basis must, in respect of the amount collected in each annual period as if it were tax imposed under the Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the month following the month in which the annual period ends, a return in a form specified by the director, and
remit with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount collected in that annual period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless the director specifies otherwise, a person who has delivered a return under this section in respect of a previous month, a calendar quarter or an annual period, as applicable, must continue to deliver a return, in accordance with subsection (1) (a), (3) (a) or (4) (a), in respect of each subsequent month, calendar quarter or annual period, whether or not an amount is to be remitted in respect of the subsequent month, calendar quarter or annual period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Payments and returns — fuel sold to retail dealers by persons other than collectors or deputy collectors
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who is required under section 35.1 (1.1) of the Act to remit money received in respect of the tax payable on fuel must, on or before the 15th day of each month in respect of money received in the previous month,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director a return in a form specified by the director, and
remit with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the money received in that previous month.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Payments and returns — amounts received as security or as if security

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), a person who is required to remit an amount under section 35.1 (1.2) of the Act must, on or before the 15th day of each month in respect of the amount that is to be remitted for the previous month,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director a return in a form specified by the director, and
remit with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount that is to be remitted for that previous month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may permit a person referred to in subsection (1) to deliver returns and remit amounts on a quarterly or annual basis.
A person permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and remit amounts on a quarterly basis must, in respect of the amount that is to be remitted for each calendar quarter,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the first month following the calendar quarter, a return in a form specified by the director, and
remit with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount that is to be remitted for that calendar quarter.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and remit amounts on an annual basis must, in respect of the amount that is to be remitted for each annual period,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the month following the month in which the annual period ends, a return in a form specified by the director, and
remit with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount that is to be remitted for that annual period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless the director specifies otherwise, a person who has delivered a return under this section in respect of a previous month, a calendar quarter or an annual period, as applicable, must continue to deliver a return, in accordance with subsection (1) (a), (3) (a) or (4) (a), in respect of each subsequent month, calendar quarter or annual period, whether or not an amount is to be remitted in respect of the subsequent month, calendar quarter or annual period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Payments and returns — fuel used by registered consumers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), a registered consumer who is required to pay tax under section 4 (3), 5 (2), 6 (2) or (4), 7 (2), 8 (2), 10 (3), 10.1 (3), 10.3 (3) or 13.2 (1) of the Act must, on or before the 15th day of each month in respect of tax payable on fuel that is used by the person in the previous month and is of a type or subcategory of a type specified in that person's registered consumer certificate,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that previous month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A registered consumer who is required to pay tax under section 13 (3) of the Act must, at the same time tax is payable under that section, deliver to the director a return in a form specified by the director.
The director may permit a registered consumer referred to in subsection (1) to deliver returns and pay tax on a quarterly or annual basis.

A registered consumer permitted under subsection (3) to deliver returns and pay tax on a quarterly basis must, in respect of tax payable on fuel that is used by the person in each calendar quarter and is of a type or subcategory of a type specified in that person's registered consumer certificate,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the first month following the calendar quarter, a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that calendar quarter.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A registered consumer permitted under subsection (3) to deliver returns and pay tax on an annual basis must, in respect of tax payable on fuel that is used by the person in each annual period and is of a type or subcategory of a type specified in that person's registered consumer certificate,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the month following the month in which the annual period ends, a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that annual period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a registered consumer, in respect of fuel that is of a type or subcategory of a type specified in the person's registered consumer certificate, has no tax payable for a previous month, a calendar quarter or an annual period, as applicable, the registered consumer must nonetheless deliver a return, in accordance with subsection (1) (a), (4) (a) or (5) (a), in respect of the previous month, calendar quarter or annual period.
Subsection (6) does not apply to a registered consumer who is an international air service.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Payments and returns — transfer of marine diesel fuel, locomotive fuel, jet fuel or aviation fuel

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), a person who is required to pay tax under section 6 (3), 7 (3) or 8 (3) of the Act must, on or before the 15th day of each month in respect of tax payable on fuel transferred by the person in the previous month,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that previous month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may permit a person referred to in subsection (1) to deliver returns and pay tax on a quarterly or annual basis.
A person permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and pay tax on a quarterly basis must, in respect of tax payable on fuel transferred by the person in each calendar quarter,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the first month following the calendar quarter, a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that calendar quarter.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and pay tax on an annual basis must, in respect of tax payable on fuel transferred by the person in each annual period,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the month following the month in which the annual period ends, a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that annual period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless the director specifies otherwise, a person who has delivered a return under this section in respect of a previous month, a calendar quarter or an annual period, as applicable, must continue to deliver a return, in accordance with subsection (1) (a), (3) (a) or (4) (a), in respect of each subsequent month, calendar quarter or annual period, whether or not tax is payable in respect of the subsequent month, calendar quarter or annual period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Payments and returns — fuel imported by ship

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), a person who is required to pay tax in accordance with section 4 (1.11), 5 (1.1), 6 (1.1), 7 (1.1), 8 (1.1), 10 (1.11), 10.1 (1.1), 10.3 (2), 12.1 (2.1) or 13 (2) of the Act must, on or before the 15th day of each month in respect of tax payable on fuel purchased by the person in the previous month in a sale to which section 1.1 (2) (a) to (c) of the Act applies,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that previous month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may permit a person referred to in subsection (1) to deliver returns and pay tax on a quarterly or annual basis.

A person permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and pay tax on a quarterly basis must, in respect of tax payable on fuel purchased by the person in each calendar quarter in a sale to which section 1.1 (2) (a) to (c) of the Act applies,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the first month following the calendar quarter, a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that calendar quarter.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and pay tax on an annual basis must, in respect of tax payable on fuel purchased by the person in each annual period in a sale to which section 1.1 (2) (a) to (c) of the Act applies,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the month following the month in which the annual period ends, a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that annual period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless the director specifies otherwise, a person who has delivered a return under this section in respect of a previous month, a calendar quarter or an annual period, as applicable, must continue to deliver a return, in accordance with subsection (1) (a), (3) (a) or (4) (a), in respect of each subsequent month, calendar quarter or annual period, whether or not tax is payable in respect of the subsequent month, calendar quarter or annual period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Payments and returns — fuel used for new purpose

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 1.8 and subsection (2) of this section, a person who is required to pay tax under section 6 (4) or 13.2 (1) of the Act must, on or before the 15th day of each month in respect of tax payable on fuel used in the previous month,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that previous month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may permit a person referred to in subsection (1) to deliver returns and pay tax on a quarterly or annual basis.
A person permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and pay tax on a quarterly basis must, in respect of tax payable on fuel used in each calendar quarter,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the first month following the calendar quarter, a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that calendar quarter.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and pay tax on an annual basis must, in respect of tax payable on fuel used in each annual period,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the month following the month in which the annual period ends, a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that annual period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless the director specifies otherwise, a person who has delivered a return under this section in respect of a previous month, a calendar quarter or an annual period, as applicable, must continue to deliver a return, in accordance with subsection (1) (a), (3) (a) or (4) (a), in respect of each subsequent month, calendar quarter or annual period, whether or not tax is payable in respect of the subsequent month, calendar quarter or annual period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Payments and returns — fuel used for unauthorized purpose

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), a person who is required to pay tax under section 15 (3) or 16.7 (5) of the Act must, on or before the 15th day of each month in respect of tax payable on fuel or a substance used in the previous month for an unauthorized purpose,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that previous month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may permit a person referred to in subsection (1) to deliver returns and pay tax on a quarterly or annual basis.

A person permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and pay tax on a quarterly basis must, in respect of tax payable on fuel or a substance used in each calendar quarter for an unauthorized purpose,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the first month following the calendar quarter, a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that calendar quarter.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and pay tax on an annual basis must, in respect of tax payable on fuel or a substance used in each annual period for an unauthorized purpose,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the month following the month in which the annual period ends, a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that annual period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Payments and returns — fuel used within British Columbia

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 1.8 and subsection (3) of this section, a person who is required to pay tax under section 4 (3), 5 (2), 6 (2), 7 (2), 8 (2), 10 (3), 10.1 (3) or 10.3 (3) of the Act must, on or before the 15th day of each month in respect of tax payable on fuel used in the previous month,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that previous month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 1.8, a person who is required to pay tax under section 13 (3) of the Act must, at the same time tax is payable under that section, deliver to the director a return in a form specified by the director.
The director may permit a person referred to in subsection (1) to deliver returns and pay tax on a quarterly or annual basis.
A person permitted under subsection (3) to deliver returns and pay tax on a quarterly basis must, in respect of tax payable on fuel used in each calendar quarter,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the first month following the calendar quarter, a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that calendar quarter.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person permitted under subsection (3) to deliver returns and pay tax on an annual basis must, in respect of tax payable on fuel used in each annual period,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the month following the month in which the annual period ends, a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that annual period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless the director specifies otherwise, a person who has delivered a return under this section in respect of a previous month, a calendar quarter or an annual period, as applicable, must continue to deliver a return, in accordance with subsection (1) (a), (4) (a) or (5) (a), in respect of each subsequent month, calendar quarter or annual period, whether or not tax is payable in respect of the subsequent month, calendar quarter or annual period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Payments and returns — natural gas used in stationary internal combustion engine

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), a person who is required to pay tax on natural gas under section 9 (2) or 9.1 (3) of the Act must, on or before the last day of each month in respect of tax payable on natural gas used in a stationary internal combustion engine in the previous month,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that previous month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may permit a person referred to in subsection (1) to deliver returns and pay tax on a quarterly or annual basis.

A person permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and pay tax on a quarterly basis must, in respect of tax payable on the amount of natural gas used in a stationary internal combustion engine in each calendar quarter,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the last day of the first month following the calendar quarter, a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that calendar quarter.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and pay tax on an annual basis must, in respect of tax payable on the amount of natural gas used in a stationary internal combustion engine in each annual period,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the last day of the month following the month in which the annual period ends, a return in a form specified by the director, and
pay with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax payable for that annual period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless the director specifies otherwise, a person who has delivered a return under this section in respect of a previous month, a calendar quarter or an annual period, as applicable, must continue to deliver a return, in accordance with subsection (1) (a), (3) (a) or (4) (a), in respect of each subsequent month, calendar quarter or annual period, whether or not tax is payable in respect of the subsequent month, calendar quarter or annual period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Payments and returns — payment of refund of security
bcl:section.bcl:text: A vendor, wholesale dealer or retail dealer to whom section 20.11 (5) or (6) or 20.12 (6) of the Act applies

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must, on or before the 15th day of the month following the month in respect of which the vendor, wholesale dealer or retail dealer subsequently received or collected an amount referred to in section 20.11 (5) or (6) or 20.12 (6), as applicable, pay to the government the amount received or collected, and
must deliver to the director a return in a form specified by the director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Marine diesel fuel that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is suitable for use in a marine gas turbine engine, and
is purchased for use in a marine gas turbine engine that propels a commercial passenger-carrying or cargo-carrying ship,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: is exempt from tax under the Act, other than tax imposed under section 13.2 of the Act.
Marine diesel fuel for use or used in the operation of a cruise ship for a cruise that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is offered to members of the public for a fee, and
has a scheduled port of call outside of British Columbia,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: is exempt from tax under the Act, other than tax imposed under section 13.2 of the Act.
Marine diesel fuel for use or used in the operation of a ship, other than a cruise ship, that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is prohibited from coasting trade under the Coasting Trade Act (Canada), and
does not engage in coasting trade, within the meaning of that Act,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: is exempt from tax under the Act, other than tax imposed under section 13.2 of the Act.

Subject to subsection (5), a seller who sells marine diesel fuel that, under this section, is exempt from tax under the Act, and who does not collect the tax on the sale, must keep, at the seller's principal office or principal place of business in the Province, the following information in respect of the sale:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name of the purchaser;
the name of the ship in which the marine diesel fuel is to be used;
the quantity of marine diesel fuel purchased.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (4) does not apply in respect of a sale of marine diesel fuel to which section 1.1 (2) (a) to (c) of the Act applies.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemption for jet fuel used in international flights
bcl:section.bcl:text: Jet fuel used in a flight is exempt from tax imposed under section 7 (2) of the Act if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the flight

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is operated by a commercial air service, and
is provided to members of the public for a fee,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the flight

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: begins in British Columbia and ends outside of Canada, or
begins outside of Canada and ends in British Columbia, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the commercial air service referred to in paragraph (a) (i) holds a licence issued by the Canadian Transportation Agency and holds, if required by Transport Canada, an operating certificate issued by Transport Canada for the type of aircraft used for the flight.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), the amount of the allowance that may be retained under section 36 of the Act is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 0.022¢ for each litre of fuel other than natural gas, or
0.022¢ for every 810.32 litres of natural gas,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: on which security is paid as required under the Act.
The allowance retained under subsection (1) must not exceed $10 000 for the period beginning on April 1 of any year and ending on March 31 of the following year.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 94/2013, s. 6.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund or deduction for bad debts

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of the definition of "specified amount" in section 21 (1) of the Act, the specified amount in relation to a sale must be determined in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the amount of tax or security referred to in section 21 (2) (b) of the Act remitted or paid by the seller in respect of the sale;
the amount written off by the seller as unrealizable or uncollectable in respect of the sale, but not including interest charges;
the full amount of the consideration in respect of the sale including all applicable taxes or security, but not including interest charges.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A seller who makes a deduction under section 21 (3) of the Act must submit to the director any information or document required by the director.

For the purposes of section 21 (6) of the Act, the amount a seller must add to the tax to be remitted or security to be paid by the seller under the Act must be determined in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the amount of tax or security referred to in section 21 (2) (b) of the Act remitted or paid by the seller in respect of the sale;
the amount recovered by the seller that gives rise to the obligation under section 21 (6) of the Act to add an amount to the tax to be remitted or security to be paid by the seller under the Act;
the full amount of the consideration in respect of the sale including all applicable taxes or security, but not including interest charges.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 21 (7) of the Act, the amount a seller must pay to the government must be determined in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the amount of tax or security referred to in section 21 (2) (b) of the Act remitted or paid by the seller in respect of the sale;
the amount recovered by the seller that gives rise to the obligation under section 21 (7) of the Act to pay an amount to the government;
the full amount of the consideration in respect of the sale including all applicable taxes or security, but not including interest charges.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that a person has paid tax under section 4 or 10 of the Act on fuel that is used for the operation of the engine of a motor vehicle while the vehicle is stationary, the director must pay the person a refund equal to the difference between the tax paid under that section and the tax that would have been payable under section 5 of the Act had the fuel been coloured fuel, if the engine is operated for the purpose of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: rotating the drum on a ready mixed concrete truck and pumping ready mixed concrete,
pumping or dispensing liquids or other materials to or from a commercial motor vehicle, which does not include

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the use of a hydraulic cylinder, or
subject to paragraph (d), the use of a hydraulic arm,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: operating a mobile crane,
operating a hydraulic arm mounted on a logging truck,
operating a drilling unit that is operated by a power take-off unit, or
operating temperature control equipment to preserve goods in an insulated cargo box on a commercial motor vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that a person has paid tax under section 12.1 or 13 of the Act on fuel described in subsection (1) of this section, the director must pay the person a refund of the tax paid on the fuel under section 12.1 or 13 of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 26/2012, s. 5.]
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 181/2001, s. 1.]
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 26/2012, s. 5.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund — jet fuel used in international flights
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person has paid tax on jet fuel that was used in a flight that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: was operated by a commercial air service, and
was provided to members of the public for a fee,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the flight

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: began in British Columbia and ended outside of Canada, or
began outside of Canada and ended in British Columbia, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the commercial air service referred to in paragraph (a) (i) holds a licence issued by the Canadian Transportation Agency and holds, if required by Transport Canada, an operating certificate issued by Transport Canada for the type of aircraft used for the flight,

bcl:section.bcl:text: the director must pay the person a refund of the tax paid on the jet fuel.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — refunds for jet fuel used in international flights

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Sections 4.1 and 4.3, as they read immediately before April 1, 2012, continue to apply to a refund claim, in respect of jet fuel, submitted before, on or after April 1, 2012, if the jet fuel was used before April 1, 2012.
Section 4.4 applies to a refund claim in respect of jet fuel only if the jet fuel is used on or after April 1, 2012.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund — spouse of person with disabilities

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: period means the period referred to in section 23 (1) of the Act;
tax means tax imposed by the Act on fuel used to propel a motor vehicle that a person with disabilities owns or leases.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, during a period or part of a period, a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is the spouse of a person with disabilities,
is 16 years of age or older, and
has paid tax in respect of a motor vehicle owned or leased by the person with disabilities,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must, subject to subsections (3) to (5), pay to the person described in paragraphs (a) to (c) a refund that is equal to the tax paid by that person during the period or part of the period, as the case may be.

If, respecting a period, there is only one applicant for a refund under this section, the refund payable to the applicant in respect of the period must not be greater than the difference between $500 and the refund paid under section 23 (1) of the Act to the person with disabilities respecting that period.
If, respecting a period, there is more than one applicant for a refund under this section,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: no refund is payable to any of the applicants in respect of the period unless a joint application is submitted by all of the applicants after that period ends,
if a joint application is submitted in accordance with paragraph (a), the refund payable to each of the applicants in respect of the joint application

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: must not exceed the tax paid by that applicant during the part of the period the applicant was the spouse of the person with disabilities, and
must be the prorated share,

bcl:clause.bcl:text: as set out in the joint application, or
as determined by the director, if the prorated share of each of the applicants is not set out in the joint application,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: of the total refund payable as calculated under paragraph (c), and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the total refund payable to all of the applicants in respect of the joint application must not be greater than the difference between $500 and the refund paid under section 23 (1) of the Act to the person with disabilities respecting the period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, respecting a period, a person with disabilities

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is paid a refund under section 23 (1) of the Act, a refund under this section respecting the period or part of the period, as the case may be, is payable to an applicant only in respect of the motor vehicle in respect of which the refund is paid to the person with disabilities, or

is not paid a refund under section 23 (1) of the Act, a refund under this section respecting the period or part of the period, as the case may be, is payable to an applicant in respect of only one motor vehicle owned or leased by the person with disabilities.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Records of vendors, wholesale dealers and retail dealers
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who is a vendor, wholesale dealer or retail dealer must keep records of inventories maintained by the person and records of each importation, manufacture, purchase and sale of fuel made by the person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person, other than a person who is required to pay tax under section 16.7 (5) of the Act, who is required to file returns for the payment of tax under the Act must keep records of the person's operations that substantiate the information provided on the person's tax returns with respect to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the importation,
the purchase,
the transfer, within the meaning of section 6 (3), 7 (3) or 8 (3) of the Act, and
use

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: of fuel by the person.

A person who is required under section 1.12 (1), (3) or (4) of this regulation to file a return for the payment of tax under section 16.7 (5) of the Act in respect of heating oil or non-motor fuel oil must keep records of the person's operations that substantiate the information provided on the person's tax return with respect to the manufacture or acquisition, and use, of the heating oil or non-motor fuel oil by the person.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who is required to obtain a declaration under section 16.6 of the Act must keep the declaration.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who is required to retain records under the Act must retain records required for the purposes of the Act or this regulation for a period of 5 years from the date the record is created.

If a person who is required to retain records under subsection (1) makes a written application to the director for permission to destroy a record, the director may authorize the requested destruction prior to the expiry of the period described in subsection (1).

Despite any other provision of this section, if a record might be necessary for the purposes of an appeal under section 50 or 51 of the Act or an appeal under section 51.92 of this regulation, the person required to keep the records must retain the record after the expiry of the period described in subsection (1) and until the appeals have been exhausted.

A person, other than a retail dealer referred to in subsection (3.1) or (3.2) or section 15.14 (3), who sells fuel to another person from a bulk storage facility, cardlock or terminal rack must provide an invoice to the person buying the fuel at the time of sale or within a reasonable time after the time of sale.
Despite subsection (1), a person who sells fuel in a sale to which section 1.1 (2) (a) to (c) of the Act applies must provide an invoice to the person buying the fuel at the time of sale.
A vendor or wholesale dealer, other than a person referred to in subsection (1), who sells fuel to a person for resale must provide an invoice to the person buying the fuel at the time of sale.
A person, other than a person referred to in subsection (1), who sells fuel to a registered consumer must provide an invoice to the registered consumer at the time of sale.
A retail dealer who sells coloured fuel to a farmer must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide an invoice to the farmer at the time of sale or within a reasonable time after the time of sale, and
on the invoice, in addition to the information required under section 5.1, specify whether tax was included in the sale.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A retail dealer who sells more than 45 litres of coloured fuel to a person must provide an invoice to the person buying the fuel at the time of sale or within a reasonable time after the time of sale.
A person who sells fuel must, if requested to do so by the person to whom the fuel is sold, provide that person with an invoice.
Subsection (4) does not apply to a person selling fuel if the person is otherwise required under this regulation to provide an invoice to the person making the request.

bcl:section.bcl:text: An invoice required to be provided by this regulation must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: specify the date of the sale,
specify the name and address of the person selling the fuel,
specify the name and address of the person to whom the fuel is sold,
specify the quantity of each type or subcategory of a type of fuel sold,
specify the rate of tax for each type or subcategory of a type of fuel sold, and
if the fuel sold is coloured fuel,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: specify the price of the coloured fuel per unit of sale, and
designate the coloured fuel sold as "Marked Fuel".

bcl:section.bcl:text: Interest payable under the Act must be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: compounded monthly, and
calculated on the number of days since the last compounding of interest, or if no compounding has yet occurred, from the date that interest is payable under the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 116/2014, s. 3.]
For the purposes of section 57.1 (2) of the Act, a certificate of lien must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be in the form specified by the director, and
include at least the following information:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the name and address of the person against whom the lien is being registered;
information sufficient to identify the real property against which the lien is being registered;
the amount remaining unpaid or unremitted.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Fuel imported by ship — classes of fuel and amounts
bcl:section.bcl:text: Each class of fuel set out in column 1 of the following table is prescribed for the purposes of section 1.1 (3) (a) (i) of the Act and the amount set out in column 2 of the table opposite a class of fuel is the amount prescribed for that class of fuel for the purposes of section 1.1 (3) (a) (ii) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 62 (6) (m) of the Act, the following enactments are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the Business Number Act;
the Civil Forfeiture Act;
section 8 of the Financial Administration Act.

bcl:part.bcl:text:
Coloured Fuel, Heating Oil and Non-Motor Fuel Oil,
and Marine Diesel Fuel and Locomotive Fuel

bcl:section.bcl:text: In sections 6 to 9 and 11, authorized person means a person who holds an authorization to colour fuel under section 14 (1) of the Act.
For the purposes of the Act and this regulation, the director may authorize types of dye that meet all of the following criteria:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: dyes must be concentrate mixtures;
dyes must be completely soluble in fuel, heating oil and non-motor fuel oil;
dyes must contain an agent for colouring fuel, heating oil and non-motor fuel oil.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An authorized person shall, for the purpose of colouring fuel,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: unless subsection (1.1) applies, obtain the dye from the director,
make a pre-mixed dye solution using a process acceptable to the director, and

use the pre-mixed dye solution referred to in paragraph (b) to colour gasoline or light fuel oil so that the gasoline or light fuel oil is coloured to a concentration of 14 parts of dye per 1 million parts of gasoline or light fuel oil.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On approval from the director, an authorized person may obtain dye from an administrator of a fuel tax statute of another province.
No person shall sell or offer for sale any fuel as coloured fuel unless the fuel has been coloured in accordance with subsection (1).

bcl:section.bcl:text: An authorized person shall not mix dye or pre-mixed dye solution with fuel or store dye or pre-mixed dye solution except

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: at a refinery that is located in the Province and is owned or leased by the authorized person,
on the premises of a bulk storage plant owned or leased by the authorized person,
at the director's discretion, on board a vessel owned or leased by the authorized person, or
by using a dye injector that is mounted on a truck that is owned or leased by the authorized person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: All dye obtained from the director remains the property of the government until the dye is mixed with fuel by the authorized person.

On cancellation by the director of a person's authority to colour fuel, the person shall promptly return the dye and pre-mixed dye solution to the director or deliver it to a person specified by the director.

On or before the 15th day of the month following the month in which an authorized person uses dye to colour fuel, as permitted in section 7, the authorized person must prepare, in the form specified by the director, a statement of the quantity of dye and pre-mixed dye solution

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in stock at the beginning of the preceding month,
received from the director during the preceding month,
used in the preceding month, and
in stock at the end of the preceding month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If requested by the director, the authorized person must deliver the statement prepared under subsection (1) to the director by the time specified by the director.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 78/94, s. 6.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prohibition against carrying dye or premixed dye solution
bcl:section.bcl:text: Unless section 7 (c) or (d) applies, no person shall carry dye or pre-mixed dye solution

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in a motor vehicle or other conveyance being used to transport petroleum products for sale or delivery, or
while on the person's body while the person is engaged in selling or delivering petroleum products.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A vendor, wholesale dealer or retail dealer shall ensure that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a pump from which the vendor, wholesale dealer or retail dealer dispenses coloured fuel, or
a container in which the vendor, wholesale dealer or retail dealer transports or delivers coloured fuel

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: is clearly labelled "COLOURED" or "MARKED" on the outside of the pump or container.
An authorized person shall ensure that a container in which the authorized person colours fuel is clearly labelled "COLOURED" or "MARKED" on the outside of the container.
No person shall use a pump or container that is labelled in accordance with subsection (1) or (2) for a fuel other than coloured fuel.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 246/2013, App. 2, s. 7.]
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 97/2008.]
The following are designated as industrial machines:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a bulldozer;
a shovel;
a backhoe;
any machine equipped with caterpillar tracks;
a crusher;
an earth compactor;
a grader;
a grass mower;
a roller;
a skidder.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The only types of motor vehicle prescribed for the purposes of section 15 (1) (d) of the Act are

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: trucks when used for hauling logs,
trucks when used for hauling lumber,
crew crummies or buses when used for the transportation of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: company employees, or
contractors or agents of the company or employees of either of them

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: carrying out an activity in the company's logging operation,
fire trucks when used as fire trucks, and
ambulances when used as ambulances.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The only types of motor vehicle prescribed for the purposes of section 15 (1) (e) of the Act are

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: trucks when used to transport minerals,
crew crummies or buses when used for the transportation of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: company employees, or
contractors or agents of the company or employees of either of them

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: carrying out an activity in the company's mineral mining operation,
fire trucks when used as fire trucks, and
ambulances when used as ambulances.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Suspension under section 14 (4) or 14.1 (4) of Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, relevant provision means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 14 (4) of the Act, or
section 14 (4) of the Act as it applies under section 14.1 (4) of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The period for which an authorization may be suspended under a relevant provision is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 90 days, unless there has been a previous suspension or cancellation as described in paragraph (b);
one year, if there has been

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a previous suspension of the authorization, or
a previous suspension or cancellation of another authorization held by the authorized person under section 14, 14.1 or 16.3 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of section 5 (3) of the Act, a farmer is eligible for exemption on purchases of coloured fuel if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the seller delivers the fuel to a storage receptacle located on the farmer's farm,
the fuel is purchased on account from a bulk agent, or
the fuel is purchased through a cardlock system.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a farmer purchases coloured fuel that does not qualify for exemption under subsection (1), the farmer must pay tax at the time of purchase and may claim a refund of the tax paid on the coloured fuel.
To claim a refund of the tax paid in accordance with subsection (2) on coloured fuel, a farmer must submit to the director the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the seller's name and address;
the date of purchase;
the number of litres purchased;
the type of fuel purchased;
a copy of the applicant's BC Farmer Identity Card issued by the BC Agriculture Council to the applicant or a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that a farmer

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has paid tax in accordance with subsection (2) on coloured fuel,
has submitted the information and documents referred to in subsection (3), and
has used the coloured fuel for a purpose authorized under section 15 of the Act,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the farmer the amount of tax paid by the farmer on that coloured fuel.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Persons selling coloured fuel to farmers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A retail dealer who sells coloured fuel to a person claiming an exemption under section 15.4 (1) in respect of the sale must ensure the sale meets one of the requirements for exemption under section 15.4 (1) and must, at or before the time of sale, obtain from the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name, address, card number and expiry date as recorded on a BC Farmer Identity Card issued by the BC Agriculture Council to the person, or
a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 246/2013, App. 2, s. 7.]
The documentation referred to in subsection (1) must be retained by the retail dealer to substantiate non-collection of tax on the sale.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Determination of amount in respect of penalty for unauthorized purchase or use of coloured fuel

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The amount referred to in section 45.3 (1) (b) of the Act in respect of a contravention of section 15 of the Act by a person is to be determined in accordance with this section.
The amount referred to in section 45.3 (1) (b) of the Act in respect of a contravention of section 15 of the Act by a person is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: $500 for a first contravention;
$750 for a second contravention;
$1 000 for a subsequent contravention.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (2),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a contravention of section 15 of the Act by a person is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a first contravention if, within the one year period immediately preceding the imposition of the penalty for that contravention, no penalty has been imposed by the director on the person under section 45.3 of the Act for another contravention of section 15 of the Act,

a second contravention if, within the one year period immediately preceding the imposition of the penalty for that contravention, one penalty has been imposed by the director on the person under section 45.3 of the Act for another contravention of section 15 of the Act, and

a subsequent contravention if, within the one year period immediately preceding the imposition of the penalty for that contravention, 2 or more penalties have been imposed by the director on the person under section 45.3 of the Act for other contraventions of section 15 of the Act, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in determining whether a contravention of section 15 of the Act is a second or subsequent contravention, the only question to be considered is the sequence of the imposition of penalties under section 45.3 of the Act and no consideration may be given to the sequence of the contraventions or whether any contravention occurred before or after the imposition of a penalty under that section.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Heating Oil and Non-Motor Fuel Oil

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application to heating oil and non-motor fuel oil

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Sections 5.7 to 10 apply in relation to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the colouring of heating oil or non-motor fuel oil as if the heating oil or non-motor fuel oil were a fuel, and
coloured heating oil or coloured non-motor fuel oil as if the coloured heating oil or coloured non-motor fuel oil were coloured fuel.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 15.3 of this regulation applies to the suspension of an authorization under section 14 (4) of the Act as that provision applies under 16.3 (6) of the Act.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Marine Diesel Fuel and Locomotive Fuel

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), if a retail dealer

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: sells fuel, whether or not the fuel is coloured fuel, through a cardlock system, or
sells more than 45 litres of fuel, whether or not the fuel is coloured fuel,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: to a person who claims that the fuel is being purchased as marine diesel fuel, the retail dealer must, at or before the time of sale, obtain from the person a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.
Subsection (1) does not apply if the fuel is transferred by the retail dealer to the supply tank or supplemental supply tank of a ship that is in or on water at the time of transfer.
The declaration obtained under subsection (1) must be retained by the retail dealer to substantiate the claim that the fuel is being purchased as marine diesel fuel.
Subject to subsection (2), if a retail dealer

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: sells fuel, whether or not the fuel is coloured fuel, through a cardlock system, or
sells more than 45 litres of fuel, whether or not the fuel is coloured fuel,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: to a person who claims that the fuel is being purchased as locomotive fuel, the retail dealer must, at or before the time of sale, obtain from the person a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.
Subsection (1) does not apply if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the retail dealer sells the fuel to a person who is a registered consumer, and
the fuel is a type or subcategory of a type of fuel specified on the person's registered consumer certificate.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The declaration obtained under subsection (1) must be retained by the retail dealer to substantiate the claim that the fuel is being purchased as locomotive fuel.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Part:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: qualifying person means a person, other than a farmer, who is a qualifying farmer as defined in section 1 (1) of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation;
residential dwelling has the same meaning as in the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation;
residential use has the same meaning as in the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Propane purchased solely for residential use in a residential dwelling is exempt from tax imposed under section 10.3 of the Act if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the retail dealer delivers or provides the propane to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a residential dwelling,
a building that contains a residential dwelling, or
a storage receptacle located at and connected to a residential dwelling, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a delivery or provision of propane to a residential dwelling that is part of a multi-use building, the retail dealer delivers or provides the propane to a storage receptacle, or through a meter, that services only the part of the building that is used only for residential use.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemption for propane — residential and farm use

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: qualifying land means, in relation to a qualifying person described in

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: paragraph (a) of the definition of "qualifying farmer" in section 1 (1) of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation, the applicable land referred to in that paragraph,
paragraph (b) of the definition of "qualifying farmer" in section 1 (1) of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation, the applicable land referred to in that paragraph, and
paragraph (c) of the definition of "qualifying farmer" in section 1 (1) of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation, the applicable land referred to in that paragraph;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: qualifying person does not include a person described in paragraph (d) of the definition of "qualifying farmer" in section 1 (1) of the Provincial Sales Tax Exemption and Refund Regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), propane is exempt from tax imposed under section 10.3 of the Act if the propane is purchased by a farmer or qualifying person for use only for

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: residential use in a residential dwelling, and
in the case of a purchase

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by a farmer, a purpose described in section 15.12 (1) (a) to (f) of this regulation, or
by a qualifying person, a purpose described in section 15.13 (1) of this regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In relation to a purchase of propane by a farmer, the exemption from tax provided for in subsection (2) applies only if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the farmer's farm contains

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a residential dwelling,
a building that contains a residential dwelling, or
a storage receptacle located at and connected to a residential dwelling, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: one of the following applies:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the retail dealer delivers the propane to a storage receptacle located on the farmer's farm;
the propane is purchased on account from a bulk agent;
the propane is purchased through a cardlock system.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In relation to a purchase of propane by a qualifying person, the exemption from tax provided for in subsection (2) applies only if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the qualifying land of the qualifying person contains

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a residential dwelling,
a building that contains a residential dwelling, or
a storage receptacle located at and connected to a residential dwelling, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: one of the following applies:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the retail dealer delivers the propane to a storage receptacle owned by the qualifying person;
the propane is purchased on account from a bulk agent;
the propane is purchased through a cardlock system.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemption for propane in types of containers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Propane contained in a sealed, pre-packaged container that holds not more than 4 litres of propane is exempt from tax imposed under section 10.3 of the Act.
Propane purchased in a pre-filled or refilled cylinder that is designed to hold not more than 28 litres of propane is exempt from tax imposed under section 10.3 of the Act.
If a collector sells, or a deputy collector or retail dealer buys, propane in

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a sealed, pre-packaged container that holds not more than 4 litres of propane, or
a sealed, pre-filled cylinder that is designed to hold not more than 28 litres of propane,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the collector, deputy collector or retail dealer is exempt from paying security under section 38, 39 or 40 of the Act, as applicable.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemption for propane made part of tangible personal property

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), propane purchased for the purpose of being processed, fabricated or manufactured into, attached to or incorporated into tangible personal property, as defined in section 1 of the Provincial Sales Tax Act, for the purpose of retail sale or lease, as those terms are defined in that section of that Act, is exempt from tax imposed under section 10.3 of the Act.
If propane is used to produce energy or is used as a source of energy, the exemption under subsection (1) does not apply to the propane.
The exemption under subsection (1) does not apply if the purchaser of the propane

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is a small seller, as defined in section 1 of the Provincial Sales Tax Act, or
is to retain an interest in the propane after the retail sale or lease of the tangible personal property referred to in subsection (1) of this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Propane purchased by a farmer is exempt from tax imposed under section 10.3 of the Act if the propane is purchased for use

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: solely for a farm purpose other than operating a motor vehicle or machinery,
in machinery on a farm for a farm purpose,
in a tractor on other than a highway,
in a tractor on a highway

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: when proceeding to or returning from a location where use of the propane in the tractor is authorized under paragraph (c), or
for the purposes of the farmer's farm,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in a farm truck being used by the farmer or other person in the operation of the farm, or
in a motor vehicle, other than a farm truck or tractor, on the farm for a farm purpose.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The exemption from tax provided for in subsection (1) applies only if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the retail dealer delivers the propane to a storage receptacle located on the farmer's farm,
the propane is purchased on account from a bulk agent, or
the propane is purchased through a cardlock system.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Propane purchased by a qualifying person is exempt from tax imposed under section 10.3 of the Act if the propane is purchased for use solely for a farm purpose other than operating a motor vehicle or machinery.
The exemption from tax provided for in subsection (1) applies only if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the retail dealer delivers the propane to a storage receptacle owned by the qualifying person,
the propane is purchased on account from a bulk agent, or
the propane is purchased through a cardlock system.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Persons selling propane to farmers and qualifying persons

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A retail dealer who sells propane to a person claiming an exemption under section 15.9 in respect of the sale must ensure the sale meets the requirements for exemption under section 15.9 and must, at or before the time of sale, obtain from the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name, address, card number and expiry date as recorded on a BC Farmer Identity Card issued by the BC Agriculture Council to the person, or
a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A retail dealer who sells propane to a person claiming an exemption under section 15.12 or 15.13 in respect of the sale must ensure the sale meets one of the requirements for exemption under section 15.12 (2) or 15.13 (2), as applicable, and must, at or before the time of sale, obtain from the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name, address, card number and expiry date as recorded on a BC Farmer Identity Card issued by the BC Agriculture Council to the person, or
a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A retail dealer who sells propane to a farmer or qualifying person must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide an invoice to the farmer or qualifying person at the time of sale or within a reasonable time after the time of sale, and
on the invoice, in addition to the information required under section 5.1, specify whether tax was included in the sale.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The documentation referred to in subsections (1) and (2) must be retained by the retail dealer to substantiate non-collection of tax on the sale.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that a person paid tax under section 10.3 of the Act in respect of propane used for residential use in a residential dwelling, the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid by the person that can reasonably be attributed to the portion of the propane used for residential use in a residential dwelling.
If

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the director is satisfied that a farmer paid tax under section 10.3 of the Act in respect of propane used for a purpose described in section 15.12 (1) (a) to (f) of this regulation, and
the exemption from tax provided for in section 15.12 (1) of this regulation did not apply because none of the requirements in section 15.12 (2) of this regulation were met,

bcl:section.bcl:text: the director must refund to the farmer the amount of tax paid by the farmer that can reasonably be attributed to the amount of propane used for that purpose.
If

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the director is satisfied that a qualifying person paid tax under section 10.3 of the Act in respect of propane used for a purpose described in section 15.13 (1) of this regulation, and
the exemption from tax provided for in section 15.13 (1) of this regulation did not apply because none of the requirements in section 15.13 (2) of this regulation were met,

bcl:section.bcl:text: the director must refund to the qualifying person the amount of tax paid by the qualifying person that can reasonably be attributed to the amount of propane used for that purpose.
A carrier who brings motive fuel into the Province in the supply tank of an IFTA commercial vehicle must do so,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the carrier's base jurisdiction is the Province, in accordance with

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: section 42, or
an IFTA licence issued to that person by the director,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the carrier's base jurisdiction is an IFTA jurisdiction other than the Province, in accordance with

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a motive fuel user permit issued to that person under section 40, or
an IFTA licence issued by the carrier's base jurisdiction, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the carrier's base jurisdiction is not the Province or an IFTA jurisdiction, in accordance with

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a motive fuel user permit issued to that person under section 40, or
an IFTA licence issued to that person by the director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A carrier referred to in section 16 (a) or (c) seeking to obtain or renew an IFTA licence must submit to the director

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an application referred to in section 19 of the Act,
an IFTA decal application,
any bond required by the director, and
the required fees.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The fees required under subsection (1) (d) are,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a new licence, an initiation fee of $200 and a licence fee of $100, and
in the case of a renewal of a licence, a licence fee of $100.

bcl:section.bcl:text: After receipt of the materials required under section 17 (1) for the issuance of a new IFTA licence, the director must issue to the applicant under section 19 of the Act

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an IFTA licence in the form established by IFTA, and
2 IFTA decals in the form established by IFTA for each IFTA commercial vehicle listed in the IFTA decal application.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Terms and conditions of IFTA licence

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: It is a condition of an IFTA licence issued by the director that the IFTA licensee must comply with IFTA.
On issuing or renewing an IFTA licence, the director may impose additional terms and conditions on the licence that the director considers necessary in relation to the administration of IFTA.
An IFTA licence and IFTA decals issued by the director are effective January 1 and expire December 31 of the same year.
On an application made after October 1 but during the currency of an IFTA licence, the director must renew the IFTA licence if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant files with the director the materials required under section 17 for the renewal of a licence,

the applicant has filed all necessary returns and has paid all taxes and amounts equivalent to tax that the carrier is required to pay to the Province and all other IFTA jurisdictions along with all penalties and interest due on those payments, and
the applicant's licence is not, at the time the application is received, suspended or cancelled.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On the renewal of an IFTA licence, the director must provide to the applicant

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an IFTA licence in the form established by IFTA, and
2 IFTA decals in the form established by IFTA for each IFTA commercial vehicle owned or operated by the carrier.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Lost or damaged licences or decals
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that an IFTA licence or an IFTA decal is lost, destroyed or illegible, the director must, on application, issue a replacement licence or decal.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An IFTA licensee must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: carry a copy of the IFTA licence in the cab of each IFTA commercial vehicle operating under that IFTA licence,
present the copy of the IFTA licence for inspection at the request of a police officer or other authorized person, and
affix an IFTA decal on each side of the cab of each IFTA commercial vehicle operating under that IFTA licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An IFTA licensee who ceases to engage in interjurisdictional transportation of passengers or goods must promptly remove all IFTA decals from its vehicles, return the original IFTA licence to the director and destroy all copies of the IFTA licence.

An IFTA licensee who ceases to use an IFTA commercial vehicle for which an IFTA decal has been acquired under section 18 or 19 for the interjurisdictional transportation of passengers or goods must promptly remove the IFTA decals from the vehicle.

bcl:section.bcl:hnote: [en. B.C. Reg. 550/95, Sch. s. 2; am. B.C. Reg. 217/2007, ss. 2 and 3.]

bcl:section.bcl:text: If the legal status, name or address of an IFTA licensee changes, the carrier must promptly return the IFTA licence to the director for amendment or as part of an application for a new IFTA licence, as the case may be.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The holder of an IFTA licence issued by the director must quarterly, in accordance with IFTA, deliver to the director a return, in a form specified by the director, setting out all of the information required under IFTA.
Each return referred to in subsection (1) must be provided to the director on or before the date by which that return is to be provided under IFTA.

With each return submitted under section 23, an IFTA licensee must calculate, for each IFTA jurisdiction, including the Province, in which the IFTA commercial vehicles of the carrier in respect of which the IFTA licence was acquired travelled during the period for which the report is prepared,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the quantity of fuel consumed by those vehicles in that jurisdiction,
the quantity of the fuel acquired by the carrier in that jurisdiction for which the tax payable to that jurisdiction has been paid, and

the tax payable to that jurisdiction for the difference between the quantity of fuel referred to in paragraph (a) and the quantity of fuel referred to in paragraph (b) or, if the quantity of fuel referred to in paragraph (b) exceeds the quantity of fuel referred to in paragraph (a), the refund claimed from that jurisdiction.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The IFTA licensee must remit with each report the tax payable to the Province as calculated under subsection (1) and an amount equal to the tax payable to each of the other IFTA jurisdictions referred to in the report as calculated under subsection (1) or, if the aggregate amount of tax-paid fuel referred to in subsection (1) (b) exceeds the aggregate amount of fuel referred to in subsection (1) (a), the carrier may claim a refund.
In this section, a return means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to an IFTA licensee that received its IFTA licence from the director, a return submitted by the licensee under section 23, and
in relation to an IFTA licensee that received its IFTA licence from an IFTA jurisdiction other than the Province, a return submitted by the licensee to that jurisdiction in accordance with IFTA.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An IFTA licensee is entitled to a refund that is payable in accordance with IFTA and calculated in accordance with subsection (3) if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the IFTA licensee files a return in accordance with IFTA, and
during the period for which a return is prepared

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the quantity of gasoline or motive fuel purchased in the Province by the IFTA licensee

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: exceeds

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the quantity of gasoline or motive fuel consumed in the Province by the IFTA licensee.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A refund under subsection (2) is to be calculated by multiplying the difference between the amount referred to in subsection (2) (b) (i) and the amount referred to in subsection (2) (b) (ii) by the cents per litre as set out in column 2 or 3 of the following table, whichever is applicable, shown opposite the period in which the fuel referred to in subsection (2) (b) (i) was purchased.
