bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The holder of an IFTA licence issued by the director must maintain records of its operations, including documentation supporting all travel as well as all fuel purchases and related receipts, to substantiate the information provided on its tax returns.
The records specified in subsection (1) must be retained for a period of 4 years after the date on which the tax return to which those records relate was due.
Promptly after receiving the request of the director to do so, an IFTA licensee must provide access to the records specified in subsection (1) to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the director, or
officials from other IFTA jurisdictions.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Cancellation or suspension of IFTA licence

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On the request of a holder of an IFTA licence issued by the director, the director must cancel the carrier's IFTA licence if the licensee has satisfied

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: all reporting requirements under IFTA, and
all liabilities for taxes under IFTA that are due to IFTA jurisdictions, including the Province, or amounts equal to those taxes and any related penalty or interest charges.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In addition to the director's powers under subsection (1), the director may cancel or suspend an IFTA licence and IFTA decals for any failure by the licensee to comply with

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the provisions of the Act or the regulations, including, without limitation,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the failure to deliver a return as required under section 23 (1), or
the failure to remit a payment as required under section 24, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the terms of IFTA, including, without limitation, the failure to pay an audit assessment within the time period established under IFTA unless that assessment has been appealed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the director cancels or suspends a licence under section 19 (4) of the Act, the director must promptly notify, in writing, the licensee and all IFTA member jurisdictions as to the cancellation or suspension.
An IFTA licensee whose IFTA licence is cancelled or suspended under this section must,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: promptly after receiving notice of that cancellation,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: return the IFTA licence and all unused IFTA decals to the director, and
remove from its commercial vehicles all IFTA decals and copies of the licence, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for a period of 4 years after the date of the last tax return and payment, retain all records pertaining to its operations under IFTA.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Any IFTA jurisdiction may conduct a final audit of the records of a carrier whose IFTA licence has been cancelled, provided that the audit is conducted within 4 years after the date of the cancellation of the licence.
The director may reinstate a suspended or cancelled IFTA licence if the licensee

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: files all required returns,
remits to the director all outstanding liabilities due to the Province and all other IFTA jurisdictions,
posts a bond, if required by the director, in an amount required by the director, and
meets any other conditions imposed by the director for the reinstatement of the licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an IFTA licensee meets all of the terms and conditions imposed under subsection (1), the director must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: reinstate the carrier's IFTA licence, and
promptly notify all IFTA jurisdictions that the suspension or cancellation has been lifted.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Issue of motive fuel user permit

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director must, on application, issue a motive fuel user permit for an IFTA commercial vehicle to a person who

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: brings motive fuel into the Province in the supply tank of the IFTA commercial vehicle, and
pays a deposit equal to the greater of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 7¢ for each kilometre that the IFTA commercial vehicle will travel in the Province, as estimated by the director in accordance with subsections (2) and (3), to a maximum of $140.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may estimate the number of kilometres the IFTA commercial vehicle will travel in the Province based on the load manifests, bills of lading, trip sheets or other documentation presented by the person required to pay the deposit under subsection (1).

If, in the opinion of the director, the documentation referred to in subsection (2) is inadequate for the purpose of making an estimate under subsection (1), the director may estimate the number of kilometres by a method the director considers appropriate.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund of IFTA commercial vehicle deposit

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), a person who pays a deposit under section 40 in respect of a permit authorizing a trip for an IFTA commercial vehicle is entitled to a refund of an amount, if any, determined in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: is the amount of the deposit paid;
is the amount of tax paid by the person for motive fuel that was purchased in British Columbia during the trip for use in the vehicle;
is the actual distance traveled by the vehicle in the Province.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A refund under subsection (1) for a trip may not exceed the amount of the deposit paid under section 40 for the trip.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Additional refund for IFTA commercial vehicle
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person paid a deposit under section 40 for a trip, and
the amount of the deposit less any refund paid to the person under section 40.1 for the trip exceeds the tax payable under sections 10 (3) and 13 (3) of the Act,

bcl:section.bcl:text: the director must pay that person a refund equal to the amount of the excess.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Remittance of tax by IFTA commercial vehicle
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who pays a deposit under section 40 in respect of a permit authorizing a trip for an IFTA commercial vehicle must, in accordance with sections 10 (3) and 13 (3) of the Act, pay to the director the amount by which

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the product of the quantity of motive fuel used in British Columbia in the vehicle during the trip multiplied by 15 cents per litre;

bcl:section.bcl:text: exceeds

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount that equals the sum of the deposit paid plus the amount of tax paid by the person for motive fuel that was purchased in British Columbia during the trip for use in the vehicle, minus a refund, if any, paid under section 40.1 for the trip.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Duty to produce motive fuel user permit
bcl:section.bcl:text: On request of a peace officer or person authorized by the director, the operator of an IFTA commercial vehicle in respect of which a motive fuel user permit has been issued must produce the permit for inspection.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who brings motive fuel into the Province is, in respect of that motive fuel, exempt from the requirements of section 16 (1) of the Act if the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is resident in the Province,
on bringing motive fuel into the Province in the supply tank of an IFTA commercial vehicle, delivers to the director a statement of the amount of motive fuel brought into the Province, and
with the statement, remits tax at the rate payable under sections 10 and 13 of the Act on the amount of motive fuel brought into the Province.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On request of a peace officer or person authorized by the director, a person described in subsection (1) must produce for inspection a copy of the statement referred to in subsection (1) (b).

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person is exempt from the requirements of section 16 (1) and (2) of the Act in respect of an IFTA commercial vehicle if the person, in respect of that vehicle,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: holds a permit issued under Division 14 of the Motor Vehicle Regulations, B.C. Reg. 26/58, and

has paid to the director an amount equal to the amount of the deposit or tax that would have been payable under section 40 (1) (b) had the person applied for a motive fuel user permit for the IFTA commercial vehicle.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 168/2008, Sch. B, s. 16.]
Carriers who hold an IFTA licence or a motive fuel user permit issued in the Province and who operate a bulk storage facility must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: maintain a record, in the form specified by the director, of the quantity of fuel handled during each month, specifying

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the fuel in stock, received, used and sold, and
whether tax was paid on the acquisition of that fuel, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: retain any documents necessary to substantiate the record maintained under paragraph (a).

bcl:section.bcl:text: Section 16 does not apply to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: persons operating ambulances, school buses, firetrucks, taxis or police vehicles, or
persons operating recreational vehicles exclusively for their personal use.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who uses motive fuel in the operation of a commercial motor vehicle that is registered for farm use outside the Province is, in respect of motive fuel brought by the person into the Province in the supply tank of the commercial motor vehicle, exempt from tax imposed under section 10 or 13 of the Act.
Section 5.02 does not apply in respect of a person who is exempt from tax under subsection (1).

bcl:section.bcl:text: A visiting force, as defined in section 2 of the Visiting Forces Act (Canada), is exempt from paying tax under the Act.
In this Part:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: air toxic means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for fuels used in a gasoline engine or an engine that is used to propel a type of vehicle that would ordinarily be propelled by a gasoline engine, benzene, 1,3 butadiene, formaldehyde, acetaldehyde or polycyclic organic matter, and

for fuels used in a diesel engine or an engine that is used to propel a type of vehicle that would ordinarily be propelled by a diesel engine, benzene, 1,3 butadiene, formaldehyde, acetaldehyde or polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Category 1 alternative motor fuel means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a fuel, used to propel motor vehicles, that when compared to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: gasoline, if the fuel is for use in a gasoline engine or an engine that is used to propel a type of vehicle that would ordinarily be propelled by a gasoline engine, or
diesel fuel, if the fuel is for use in a diesel engine or an engine that is used to propel a type of vehicle that would ordinarily be propelled by a diesel engine

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is shown in tests and analyses approved by the Minister of Environment and performed by a testing agency approved by that ministry to have the potential

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: to produce at least a 15% reduction in emissions from motor vehicle operation of at least one emission group,
to produce at least a 5% reduction in emissions from motor vehicle operation of at least one other emission group, and
to produce no more than 5% increase in emissions from motor vehicle operation of any other emission group,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 94/2013, s. 18.]

hydrogen, when used in fuel-cell vehicles, except hydrogen that is produced by electrolysis using coal-generated electricity, unless the carbon dioxide emitted as the result of using coal to generate the electricity is captured and stored or captured and sequestered, or

hydrogen, when used in internal combustion engine vehicles, except hydrogen that is produced by electrolysis using coal-generated electricity, unless the carbon dioxide emitted as the result of using coal to generate the electricity is captured and stored or captured and sequestered;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Category 2 alternative motor fuel means fuel, used to propel motor vehicles, that when compared to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: gasoline, if the fuel is for use in a gasoline engine or an engine that is used to propel a type of vehicle that would ordinarily be propelled by a gasoline engine, or
diesel fuel, if the fuel is for use in a diesel engine or an engine that is used to propel a type of vehicle that would ordinarily be propelled by a diesel engine

bcl:definition.bcl:text: is shown in tests and analyses approved by the Minister of Environment and performed by a testing agency approved by that ministry to have the potential

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from motor vehicle operation by at least 20%, and
to produce no increase in emissions from motor vehicle operation of any other emission group;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Category 3 alternative motor fuel means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: fuel, used to propel motor vehicles, that when compared to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: gasoline, if the fuel is for use in a gasoline engine or an engine that is used to propel a type of vehicle that would ordinarily be propelled by a gasoline engine, or
diesel fuel, if the fuel is for use in a diesel engine or an engine that is used to propel a type of vehicle that would ordinarily be propelled by a diesel engine

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is shown in tests and analyses approved by the Minister of Environment and performed by a testing agency approved by that minister to have the potential

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from motor vehicle operation by at least 35%, and
to produce no increase in emissions from motor vehicle operation of any other emission group;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 307/2009, s. 2 (a).]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: diesel fuel means petroleum-based diesel fuel;
emission group means one of the following groups:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: greenhouse gases;
nitrogen oxides;

particulate matter and air toxics;
volatile organic compounds;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: gasoline means petroleum-based gasoline;
greenhouse gases means a combination of carbon dioxide, methane and nitrous oxide, evaluated on a life-cycle basis;
volatile organic compound means any organic compound other than methane that participates in atmospheric photochemical reactions.

In this Part:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: exempt fuel retailer means a person who holds an exempt fuel retailer permit;
exempt fuel retailer permit means a permit issued under this Part;

qualifying purchaser means a purchaser who is exempt from tax

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: under section 87 of the Indian Act (Canada), or

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3) and on receipt of an application in the form specified by the director, the director may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: issue an exempt fuel retailer permit for a type or subcategory of a type of fuel to a retail dealer whom the director considers is suitable and who is located on land that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is reserve land, or
was formerly reserve land and where by virtue of an agreement between the government and a First Nation, purchasers could be qualifying purchasers, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: make the exempt fuel retailer permit subject to any other conditions and limitations specified by the director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A retail dealer who wishes to obtain an exempt fuel retailer permit must apply to the director for a permit for a specific location at which the retail dealer intends to sell the specified fuel.

Before an applicant is issued an exempt fuel retailer permit, the applicant must enter into an agreement with the director, on behalf of the government, that sets out the duties to be performed by the retailer and any other matters the director considers necessary or advisable.
An exempt fuel retailer must display the exempt fuel retailer permit in a prominent position at the location at which the retailer sells the specified fuel.
The director may set a percentage for a type or subcategory of a type of fuel that may be purchased for resale by an exempt fuel retailer without paying security under section 40 of the Act.
The director may set different percentages for different types or subcategories of a type of fuel or for different retailers.
The director

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may change the percentage of specified fuel with 30 days notice to the exempt fuel retailer, and

may set or change the percentage of specified fuel, without advance notice, if the exempt fuel retailer fails to comply with the Act, this regulation or the terms and conditions of the exempt fuel retailer permit or an agreement under section 51.7 (3).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may change the percentage of specified fuel at the request of the exempt fuel retailer, without advance notice, if the director is satisfied that the change is appropriate.
A collector or deputy collector who sells specified fuel to an exempt fuel retailer must not collect security under section 40 of the Act in respect of the exempt percentage of that fuel.
A collector who sells specified fuel to an exempt fuel retailer need not pay security under section 38 of the Act in respect of the exempt percentage of that fuel.

If the director is satisfied that a deputy collector has paid security on specified fuel that was sold to an exempt fuel retailer, the director must pay the deputy collector a refund equal to the difference between the amount of security the deputy collector paid on the fuel and the amount of security or tax the deputy collector received for the fuel.
Subject to subsection (2), an exempt fuel retailer must, on or before the 15th day of each month in respect of fuel purchased or sold in the previous month,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director a return in a form specified by the director,
subject to subsection (4.1), deliver with the return referred to in paragraph (a) any other documentation specified by the director, and
remit with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax collected in that previous month.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may permit an exempt fuel retailer to deliver returns and remit tax on a quarterly or annual basis.
An exempt fuel retailer permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and remit tax on a quarterly basis must, in respect of fuel purchased or sold in each calendar quarter,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the first month following the calendar quarter, a return in a form specified by the director,
subject to subsection (4.1), deliver with the return referred to in paragraph (a) any other documentation specified by the director, and
remit with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax collected in that calendar quarter.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An exempt fuel retailer permitted under subsection (2) to deliver returns and remit tax on an annual basis must, in respect of fuel purchased or sold in each annual period,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the director, on or before the 15th day of the month following the month in which the annual period ends, a return in a form specified by the director,
subject to subsection (4.1), deliver with the return referred to in paragraph (a) any other documentation specified by the director, and
remit with the return referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax collected in that annual period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may permit an exempt fuel retailer to deliver some or all of the documentation referred to in subsection (1) (b), (3) (b) or (4) (b), as applicable, to the director on or before the last day of the month in which the return referred to in that subsection is delivered to the director.

If an exempt fuel retailer has not collected tax in a previous month, a calendar quarter or an annual period, as applicable, the exempt fuel retailer must nonetheless deliver a return, in accordance with subsection (1) (a), (3) (a) or (4) (a), in respect of the previous month, calendar quarter or annual period.
If an exempt fuel retailer permit is suspended under section 51.9 (1), the exempt fuel retailer must continue to deliver returns and remit tax under subsection (1), (3) or (4), as applicable.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Suspension and cancellation of exempt fuel retailer permit

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may, without giving advance notice to the exempt fuel retailer, suspend an exempt fuel retailer permit for a period of up to 60 days

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the director is satisfied that the exempt fuel retailer knowingly gave false information on an application for the exempt fuel retailer permit, or
if the exempt fuel retailer refuses or neglects to comply with

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a provision of the Act or this regulation,
a condition or limitation specified by the director on the permit, or
a provision of an agreement referred to in section 51.7 (3).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the director suspends the exempt fuel retailer permit of a person under subsection (1), the director must, as soon as reasonably possible,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: advise the person of the reasons for the suspension, and
provide the person with an opportunity to show the director why the suspension should be lifted.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (5), the director may, by notice delivered to the exempt fuel retailer, cancel the exempt fuel retailer permit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the director is satisfied that the exempt fuel retailer knowingly gave false information on an application for the exempt fuel retailer permit, or
if the exempt fuel retailer refuses or neglects to comply with

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a provision of the Act or this regulation,
a condition or limitation specified by the director on the permit, or
a provision of an agreement referred to in section 51.7 (3).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director must, by notice delivered to the exempt fuel retailer, cancel the exempt fuel retailer permit, if the exempt fuel retailer obtained an exempt fuel retailer permit to operate at a location on land referred to in section 51.7 (1) (a) (ii) and that land ceases to be land where purchasers can be qualifying purchasers.
Before cancelling an exempt retailer permit under subsection (3), the director must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: give the exempt fuel retailer notice of the reasons for the proposed cancellation, and
provide the exempt fuel retailer with an opportunity to show the director why the permit should not be cancelled.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Cancellation of an exempt fuel retailer permit under subsection (3) or (4) takes effect on the later of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the date that notice of it is delivered to the exempt fuel retailer, and
the date stated in the notice.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A suspension or cancellation of a permit under this section does not relieve a retail dealer from any liability.

If an exempt fuel retailer permit issued to a person under the Carbon Tax Act is suspended under that Act, the exempt fuel retailer permit issued to that person under this regulation is automatically suspended without notice for the same period as the suspension under the Carbon Tax Act.

If an exempt fuel retailer permit issued to a person under the Carbon Tax Act is cancelled under that Act, the exempt fuel retailer permit issued to that person under this regulation is automatically cancelled without notice.
An appeal to the minister lies from a decision of the director about any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a refusal to issue an exempt fuel retailer permit;
the cancellation of an exempt fuel retailer permit, other than a cancellation under section 51.9 (4);
the setting or changing of the percentage of specified fuel under section 51.71, or a refusal to change that percentage.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (1.2), written notice of the appeal must be given to the minister within 90 days after the date of the director's notice of decision.
With respect to a decision of the director made prior to September 2, 2009,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: no appeal lies from a decision if the date on the director's notice of decision is a date prior to 90 days before September 2, 2009, and
the 90 day time limit referred to in subsection (1.1) begins on the date on the director's notice of decision.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The appellant must set out in the notice of appeal a statement of all material facts and the reasons in support of the appeal.
On receiving the notice of appeal, the minister must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: consider the matter,
subject to subsection (4), affirm, amend or change the decision, and
promptly notify the appellant in writing of the result of the appeal.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: affirm the decision of the director,
direct the director to issue an exempt fuel retailer permit to the appellant, subject to the conditions and limitations that the director specifies, or
direct the director to set or change the percentage of specified fuel under section 51.71, subject to the conditions and limitations that the director specifies.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may, in writing, delegate any of the minister's powers or duties under this section.
A delegation under subsection (4.1) may be to a named person or to a class of persons.
Sections 51 and 52 of the Act apply to appeals under this section.
The date on which a notice of appeal is given to the minister under section 51.92 (1.1) is the date it is received by the minister.
A notice of appeal is conclusively deemed to have been given to the minister if it is received at a location and by a method specified by the minister.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation, as it read on October 31, 2022, continues to apply in relation to a notice of appeal under section 51.92 from a decision of the director if the director's notice of decision is dated on or before October 31, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on the first conviction, to a fine of not less than $200 and not more than $500, and

on a subsequent conviction for contravention of the same or another provision of this regulation, to a fine of not less than $500 and not more than $2 000 or to imprisonment for not less than 90 days and not more than 180 days, or to both.
